newsitem.title: USA: Ostex awarded $6.4 mln in Boehringer case.
newsitem.headline: Ostex awarded $6.4 mln in Boehringer case.

text.p: Ostex International Inc. said Thursday it has received a final award of $6.4 million from an arbitration panel in connection with its claims against Boehringer Mannheim, a division of Corange International.
The hearing before the panel of the American Arbitration Association was held here on Sept. 3-11, 1996, Ostex said.

Ostex said the panel determined that Boehringer Mannheim breached a license agreement with Ostex by failing to use its best efforts to effectively promote the Osteomark Microtiter plate kits. The panel denied Boehringer Mannheim's counterclaims, Ostex said.
The panel told Boehringer Mannheim to pay Ostex $5.72 million in damages for lost profits, and $700,000 to reimburse Ostex for part of its attorneys fees and expenses.
Ostex initiated proceedings on Aug. 25, 1995, when it filed an action in a federal court in the state of Washington seeking arbitration. On Dec. 5, 1995, the court granted the request.
Ostex is engaged in the discovery, development and commercialization of diagnostics and therapeutics for diseases of the skeleton and connective tissues.
